channel.title: In need of assistance with webclient
channel.description:
I need help with my webclient, because when I try to upload it; it comes up saying "Error! Click for details." and when I click that it says "client.class". I also had a problem finding some things when doing CTRL + F and couldn't actually find the coding when I was looking for it? That was needed to make the webclient work.
If you have any help or reasons why it doesn't work, message me or reply below please!!
James
Edit: [IMG]http://i1275.photobucket.com/albums/y446/james_duncan3/error_zpsa0524478.png[/img]

item.title: In need of assistance with webclient
item.dc:creator: @iBunnie iBunnie
item.description:
@iBunnie wrote:

Fix: Delete all of your .class files from the folder you jarr’d, and then re-compile. This happens with higher revision java jdk’s.(recommend a 1.6.0 version)

Read full topic
item.source: In need of assistance with webclient

follow a tut man. its a easy fix… r delete what u have n get a base n source go w a tut it be a lot easier pi is the best for starters/

I also had a problem finding some things when doing CTRL + F and couldn’t actually find the coding when I was looking for it? That was needed to make the webclient work.

error_zpsa0524478.png1024×575
[/quote]
1 of 3 problems ur client.jar isnt in the website files… are your htlm code isnt pathed with ur client.jar say u named ur client client.jar has to be same name… and ur client.class has to be the same. are u messed up n didnt make webclient right… try different html. .>>>>>>I also had a problem finding some things when doing CTRL + F and couldn’t actually find the coding when I was looking for it?<<<< sounds like the problem there
